newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's Jan-May vehicle sales up 8.9 pct.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's Jan-May vehicle sales up 8.9 pct.

text.p: Vehicle sales in Colombia rose 8.9 percent in the first five months of 1997 compared to the same period last year, a closely watched auto industry survey showed Friday.
The survey, compiled by GM Colmotores, the local subsidiary of General Motors Corp, said 53,159 cars and trucks were sold in Colombia in January-May, up from 48,778 in the same period a year ago.
Sales grew by a hefty 22.3 percent in May to a total of 12,205 units, up from 9,978 in May 1996, the survey said.
